stories.text:
It looks like Google backpedaled on their decision to force people to upgrade their "Google Apps for your Domain" accounts.

https://support.google.com/a/answer/60217?hl=en

> If you’re using the G Suite legacy free edition for non-commercial purposes, you can opt out of the transition to Google Workspace by clicking here […] You can continue using your custom domain(s) with Gmail, retain access to no-cost Google services such as Google Drive and Google Meet, and keep your purchases and data.
stories.title: Tell HN: G Suite legacy free edition got revived

stories.text:
There was a buzzword Big Data which regularly popped up in tech news. I haven’t seen the word used much lately. What advances are being made on it?

I imagine with various privacy scandals it fell out of favour since your data should be /your/ data only.

And many have talked about data being the ‘new oil’ when really it should be reframed as radioactive waste.

What happened to using this term to hype up your brand: ‘We use Big Data to infer information about how to improve and go forward’?

Was it just a hyped up buzzword?
stories.title: Ask HN: What Happened to Big Data?
